definition: to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: An army of doctors blitzed the disease .
sentences.chinese: 一大批醫生對這種疾病發起猛攻。

sentences.english: Italy's metal-workers' union calls goes on strike.
sentences.chinese: 意大利鋼鐵工人聯盟發起罷工。

sentences.english: You may be thinking about initiating a law case in mid-January.
sentences.chinese: 你可能會在1月中旬考慮發起一項法律案。

sentences.english: The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise adevice for getting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代辦顧問發起校訂者想出一個根除敗行的計謀。

sentences.english: When the British’s demands were not met, they opened fired on the far weaker Zanzibar.
sentences.chinese: 英國的要求沒人理，最後對弱小的桑給巴爾發起攻擊。

sentences.english: I am an initiator of several corporative standards.
sentences.chinese: 我是幾個法人標準的發起者。

sentences.english: Its final aim was to repulse the third anti-communist upsurge launched by the KMT diehards.
sentences.chinese: 其最終目的是打退國民黨頑固派發起的三次反共高潮。

sentences.english: A piece that is dislodged has no effect on the spaceprovince from which the mover came that dislodged it.
sentences.chinese: 被擊退的單位對發起進攻的省份沒有任何影響。

sentences.english: He initiated and managed technology collaborations with Chinese partners for GM.
sentences.chinese: 他爲通用汽車發起並管理與中國合作伙伴的技術協作。

sentences.english: We renewed the attack after stopping for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 停了兩小時後，我們重新發起進攻。

sentences.english: We started a campaign for money-raising for the flooded area-Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 我們發起了一個爲洪災地區募捐的活動。

sentences.english: The labor song is the oldest ballad directly originating from physical labor.
sentences.chinese: 勞動歌是由體力勞動直接激發起來的最古老的歌謠。

sentences.english: It's a daring way to jump-start one's own literary celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 發起自己在文學上的聲望是一種很大膽的方式。

sentences.english: He is counted as a national hero.
sentences.chinese: 那個國家發起了一場全國性的反貪污運動。

sentences.english: This can be a surreptitious method of mounting a takeover bid.
sentences.chinese: 這可以是祕密發起收購的一種方式。

sentences.english: How (and why) was this project ever started?
sentences.chinese: 這個項目是如何發起的？

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
